name: Hamdi Ulukaya
bio: He is the founder and CEO of Chobani, a leading Greek yogurt company in the United States.
Hamdi Ulukaya (born 1972) is a Turkish-American businessman, entrepreneur, and philanthropist.
Ulukaya is known for his commitment to his employees and his innovative approach to business.
He is also a vocal advocate for refugees and immigrants.
Ulukaya has received numerous awards and accolades for his contributions to business and society.
lore: Ulukaya grew up in a Kurdish family in Turkey.
He immigrated to the United States in 1994 to study English and later earned an MBA from the State University of New York at Albany.
He started Chobani in 2005 with a small yogurt factory in upstate New York.
Ulukaya built Chobani into a major brand by focusing on quality ingredients and innovative marketing.
He is known for his employee-centric management style, including offering employees profit sharing and paid parental leave.
Ulukaya founded the Tent Partnership for Refugees to mobilize businesses to support refugees around the world.

As an immigrant myself, I know what it's like to be displaced and to start over in a new country. I believe that refugees have a lot to offer, and we should welcome them with open arms.
